member.name: T:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash
member.summary: Represents a reusable hashing object and contains the result of a hashing operation.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.CanReuseTransform
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current transform can be reused.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.CanTransformMultipleBlocks
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether multiple blocks can be transformed.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.InputBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the input block size.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.OutputBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the output block size.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.Append(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Appends a binary encoded string to the data stored in the CryptographicHash object.
member.param: Data to append.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.GetValueAndReset
member.summary: Gets hashed data from the CryptographicHash object and resets the object.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.TransformBlock(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Transforms the specified region of the input byte array and copies the resulting transform to the specified region of the output byte array.
member.param: The input for which to compute the transform.
The offset into the input byte array from which to begin using data.
The number of bytes in the input byte array to use as data.
The output to which to write the transform.
The offset into the output byte array from which to begin writing data.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicHash.TransformFinalBlock(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Transforms the specified region of the specified byte array.
member.param: The input for which to compute the transform.
The offset into the input byte array from which to begin using data.
The number of bytes in the input byte array to use as data.
member.remarks: TransformFinalBlock is a special function for transforming the last block or a partial block in the stream. It returns a new array that contains the remaining transformed bytes. A new array is returned, because the amount of information returned at the end might be larger than a single block when padding is added.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType
member.summary: Serialization formats for private keys.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType.Pkcs8RawPrivateKeyInfo
member.summary: The private key is encoded as an ASN.1 PrivateKeyInfo type defined in the PKCS#8 standard. The private key information syntax is defined as follows in RFC 5208.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType.Pkcs1RsaPrivateKey
member.summary: The key is an RSA private key defined in the PKCS #1 standard. For more information, see the RSA Cryptography Specification in RFC 3347.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType.BCryptPrivateKey
member.summary: Microsoft private key format defined by Cryptography API: Next Generation (CNG).

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType.Capi1PrivateKey
member.summary: Microsoft private key format defined by the legacy Cryptography API (CAPI). For more information, see Base Provider Key BLOBs.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType.BCryptEccFullPrivateKey
member.summary: A private key BLOB for an elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) key.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType
member.summary: Serialization formats for public keys.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType.X509SubjectPublicKeyInfo
member.summary: The public key is encoded as an ASN.1 SubjectPublicKeyInfo type defined in RFC 5280 and RFC 3280.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType.Pkcs1RsaPublicKey
member.summary: The key is an RSA public key defined in the PKCS #1 standard. For more information, see the RSA Cryptography Specification in RFC 3347.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType.BCryptPublicKey
member.summary: Microsoft public key format defined by Cryptography API: Next Generation (CNG).

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType.Capi1PublicKey
member.summary: Microsoft public key format defined by the legacy Cryptography API (CAPI).

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType.BCryptEccFullPublicKey
member.summary: A public key BLOB for an elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) key.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream
member.summary: Defines a stream that links data streams to cryptographic transformations.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.chainedStream
member.summary: The stream that is read from or written to with each I/O operation.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.transform
member.summary: The crypto transform to use for each block.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.mode
member.summary: The read/write mode of this stream.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.inputBuffer
member.summary: Data that has not yet been transformed.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.outputBuffer
member.summary: Data that has been transformed but not flushed.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.inputBufferSize
member.summary: The number of valid bytes in .

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.outputBufferSize
member.summary: The number of valid bytes in .

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.outputBufferIndex
member.summary: The index of the first valid byte in . This advances when Read is called with a smaller buffer than we have bytes available.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform,PCLCrypto.CryptoStreamMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The stream to write to or read from.
The cryptographic operation to use for transforming data.
The mode of operation.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.HasFlushedFinalBlock
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the final buffer block has been written to the underlying stream.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.WriteTo(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform[])
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream that can be used to write to the specified stream after passing through a series of transforms.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be written to.
The transformations to apply to the data before writing to .

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.ReadFrom(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform[])
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream that can be used to read from the specified stream, passing the retrieved data through a series of transforms before being read from this stream.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be read from.
The transformations to apply to the data after reading from .

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.FlushFinalBlock
member.summary: Updates the underlying data source or repository with the current state of the buffer, then clears the buffer.
member.remarks: Calling the Close method will call FlushFinalBlock. If you do not call Close, call FlushFinalBlock to complete flushing the buffer. Call FlushFinalBlock only when all stream activity is complete.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.Chain(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.CryptoStreamMode,PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform[])
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream chain of transforms.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be read from or written to.
Whether to prepare for read or write operations to trigger the operations.
The transforms to apply.
member.returns: The start of the chain of CryptoStreams.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.ChainWrite(System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator{PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform})
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream chain of transforms for writing streams.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be read from or written to.
An enumerator positioned just before the transform to create for the outer-most stream.
member.returns: The start of the chain of CryptoStreams.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer
member.summary: Contains static methods that implement data management functionality common to cryptographic operations.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.Compare(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Compares two byte[] objects.
member.param: First buffer to be used for comparison.
Second buffer to be used for comparison.
member.returns: True specifies that the buffers are equal. Two buffers are equal if each code point in one matches the corresponding code point in the other.

member.summary: Converts a buffer to an encoded string.
member.param: Encoding format.
Data to be encoded.
member.returns: A string that contains the encoded data.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.ConvertStringToBinary(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Converts a string to an encoded buffer.
member.param: String to be encoded.
Encoding format.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.CopyToByteArray(System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Copies a buffer to an array of bytes.
member.param: Input buffer.
An array of bytes that contains the values copied from the input buffer. You must declare the array before calling this method and pass it by using the ref keyword.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.CreateFromByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a buffer from an input byte array.
member.param: An array of bytes used to create the buffer.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.DecodeFromBase64String(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a string that has been base64 encoded.
member.param: Base64 encoded input string.
member.returns: Output buffer that contains the decoded string.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.DecodeFromHexString(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a string that has been hexadecimal encoded.
member.param: Encoded input string.
member.returns: Output buffer that contains the decoded string.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.EncodeToBase64String(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a buffer to a base64 string.
member.param: Input buffer.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.EncodeToHexString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a buffer to a hexadecimal string.
member.param: Input buffer.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.GenerateRandom(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a buffer that contains random data.
member.param: Length, in bytes, of the buffer to create.
member.returns: Output buffer that contains the random data.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicBuffer.GenerateRandomNumber
member.summary: Creates a random number.
member.returns: Integer that contains the random data.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine
member.summary: Offers functionality similar to CryptographicEngine in WinRT.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.Encrypt(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts data by using a symmetric or asymmetric algorithm.
member.param: Cryptographic key to use for encryption. This can be an asymmetric or a symmetric key. For more information, see AsymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider and SymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider.
Data to encrypt.

Buffer that contains the initialization vector. This can be null for a symmetric algorithm and should always be null for an asymmetric algorithm. If an initialization vector (IV) was used to encrypt the data, you must use the same IV to decrypt the data. You can use the GenerateRandom method to create an IV that contains random data. Other IVs, such as nonce-generated vectors, require custom implementation. For more information, see Symmetric Key Encryption.Cipher block chaining (CBC) block cipher mode algorithms require an initialization vector. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.CreateEncryptor(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a cryptographic transform for use in a CryptoStream that encrypts data.
member.param: The encryption key to use.
The initialization vector, if applicable and nonzero.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.Decrypt(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts content that was previously encrypted by using a symmetric or asymmetric algorithm.
member.param: Cryptographic key to use for decryption. This can be an asymmetric or a symmetric key. For more information, see AsymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider and SymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider.
Buffer that contains the encrypted data.
Buffer that contains the initialization vector. If an initialization vector (IV) was used to encrypt the data, you must use the same IV to decrypt the data. For more information, see Encrypt.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.CreateDecryptor(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a cryptographic transform for use in a CryptoStream that decrypts data.
member.param: The decryption key to use.
The initialization vector, if applicable and nonzero.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.Sign(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Signs digital content.
member.param: Key used for signing.
Data to be signed.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.SignHashedData(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Signs the hashed input data using the specified key.
member.param: The key to use to sign the hash.
The input data to sign. The data is a hashed value which can be obtained through incremental hash.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.VerifySignature(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies a message signature.
member.param: Key used for verification. This must be the same key previously used to sign the message.
Message to be verified.
Signature previously computed over the message to be verified.
member.returns: true if the message is verified.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.VerifySignatureWithHashInput(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the signature of the specified input data against a known signature.
member.param: The key to use to retrieve the signature from the input data.
The data to be verified. The data is a hashed value of raw data.
The known signature to use to verify the signature of the input data.
member.returns: True if the signature is verified; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicEngine.DeriveKeyMaterial(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Derives a key from another key by using a key derivation function.
member.param: The symmetric or secret key used for derivation.
Derivation parameters. The parameters vary depending on the type of KDF algorithm used.
Requested size, in bits, of the derived key.
member.returns: Buffer that contains the derived key.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey
member.summary: Represents a symmetric key or an asymmetric key pair.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey.KeySize
member.summary: Gets the size, in bits, of the key.
member.value: Integer that contains the number of bits in the key.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey.Export(PCLCrypto.CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType)
member.summary: Exports the key pair to a buffer given a specified format.
member.param: A CryptographicPrivateKeyBlobType enumeration value that specifies the format of the key in the buffer. The default value is Pkcs8RawPrivateKeyInfo.
member.returns: Buffer that contains the key pair.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey.ExportPublicKey(PCLCrypto.CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType)
member.summary: Exports a public key to a buffer given a specified format.
member.param: A CryptographicPublicKeyBlobType enumeration value that specifies the format of the key in the buffer. The default value is X509SubjectPublicKeyInfo.
member.returns: Buffer that contains the public key.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform
member.summary: Defines the basic operations of cryptographic transformations.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform.CanReuseTransform
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current transform can be reused.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform.CanTransformMultipleBlocks
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether multiple blocks can be transformed.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform.InputBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the input block size.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform.OutputBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the output block size.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform.TransformBlock(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Transforms the specified region of the input byte array and copies the resulting transform to the specified region of the output byte array.
member.param: The input for which to compute the transform.
The offset into the input byte array from which to begin using data.
The number of bytes in the input byte array to use as data.
The output to which to write the transform.
The offset into the output byte array from which to begin writing data.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform.TransformFinalBlock(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Transforms the specified region of the specified byte array.
member.param: The input for which to compute the transform.
The offset into the input byte array from which to begin using data.
The number of bytes in the input byte array to use as data.
member.remarks: TransformFinalBlock is a special function for transforming the last block or a partial block in the stream. It returns a new array that contains the remaining transformed bytes. A new array is returned, because the amount of information returned at the end might be larger than a single block when padding is added.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.IDeriveBytes
member.summary: Provides fixed-length key derivation from passwords or byte buffers of arbitrary size.

members.member:
Derives a cryptographically strong key from the specified password.
The user-supplied password. The salt. The rounds of computation to use in deriving a stronger key. The larger this is, the longer attacks will take. The desired key size in bytes. The generated key.byte[] GetBytes(string keyMaterial, byte[] salt, int iterations, int countBytes);

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.IDeriveBytes.GetBytes(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Derives a cryptographically strong key from the specified bytes.
member.param: The user-supplied password.
The salt.
The rounds of computation to use in deriving a stronger key. The larger this is, the longer attacks will take.
The desired key size in bytes.

member.summary: Gets the length, in bytes, of the hash.

member.summary: Creates a reusable ICryptographicHash object.

member.summary: Gets the algorithm used by this instance.

member.summary: Returns a key that may be used to derive another key.

member.summary: Provides access to key derivation algorithms.

member.summary: Acquires a key derivation algorithm.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParameters
member.summary: Represents parameters used when deriving a key.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParameters.IterationCount
member.summary: Gets the number of iterations used to derive the key.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParameters.KdfGenericBinary
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameters used by the key derivation algorithm.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParametersFactory
member.summary: A factory for constructing parameters for deriving a key.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParametersFactory.BuildForPbkdf2(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a KeyDerivationParameters object for use in the password-based key derivation function 2 (PBKDF2).
member.param: The salt, a random or pseudorandom value to be combined with the password in multiple iterations. A salt is used to increase entropy above what can be obtained from using a password alone.
Number of iterations to be used to derive a key.
member.returns: Refers to the parameters used during key derivation.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParametersFactory.BuildForSP800108(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a KeyDerivationParameters object for use in a counter mode, hash-based message authentication code (HMAC) key derivation function.
member.param: Buffer that specifies the purpose for the derived keying material.

Buffer that specifies information related to the derived keying material. For example, the context can identify the parties who are deriving the keying material and, optionally, a nonce known by the parties.
member.returns: Refers to the parameters used during key derivation.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.IKeyDerivationParametersFactory.BuildForSP80056a(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a KeyDerivationParameters object for use in the SP800-56A key derivation function.
member.param: Specifies the intended purpose of the derived key.
Contains public information contributed by the initiator.
Contains public information contributed by the responder.
Contains public information known to both initiator and responder.
Contains private information known to both initiator and responder, such as a shared secret.
member.returns: Refers to the parameters used during key derivation.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.IMacAlgorithmProvider
member.summary: A MAC algorithm provider.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.IMacAlgorithmProvider.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets the name of the open MAC algorithm.

member.name: P:PCLCrypto.IMacAlgorithmProvider.MacLength
member.summary: Gets the length, in bytes, of the message authentication code.
member.value: Number of bytes in the MAC.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.IMacAlgorithmProvider.CreateHash(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a CryptographicHash object that supports incremental hash operations.
member.param: Random data used to help generate the hash. You can call the GenerateRandom method to create the random data.
member.returns: A CryptographicHash object that supports incremental hash operations.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.IMacAlgorithmProvider.CreateKey(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a symmetric key that can be used to create the MAC value.
member.param: Random data used to help generate the key. You can call the GenerateRandom method to create the random data.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.IMacAlgorithmProviderFactory
member.summary: A factory for instances.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.IMacAlgorithmProviderFactory.OpenAlgorithm(PCLCrypto.MacAlgorithm)

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the specified algorithm requires an initialization vector.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.WinRTExtensions.ImportParameters(PCLCrypto.IAsymmetricKeyAlgorithmProvider,PCLCrypto.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Creates a cryptographic key based on the specified RSA parameters.
member.param: The asymmetric algorithm provider.
The RSA parameters from which to initialize the key.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.WinRTExtensions.ExportParameters(PCLCrypto.ICryptographicKey,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exports the RSA parameters of a cryptographic key.
member.param: The cryptographic key.
true to include the private key in the exported parameters; false to only include the public key.
member.returns: The RSA parameters for the key.
